title: France's 2026 budget battle is finally over. The next one may be even more complex.
subhead: The Finance Ministry is already working on the next budget bill. On paper, France will need to make a deficit reduction effort twice as great as in 2026. It will be a daunting challenge, so close to the presidential election.

title: One month after Maduro's abduction in Venezuela, the transition of power is unclear
Mark Carney, a prime minister seeking to free Canada from US dominance
Clintons to testify in US House-led Epstein investigation
subhead: A spokesperson for the former US president said that Bill and Hillary Clinton will testify in an investigation surrounding Jeffrey Epstein. 'They look forward to setting a precedent that applies to everyone,' he said.

title: Macron keeps press at bay for meetings with public
subhead: The French president will visit eastern Vesoul on Tuesday to discuss agriculture and social media. Journalists will not have access to his meetings with farmers and high school students.

title: Comic books: After Angoulême, a new French festival shows promise
subhead: After the International Comic Book Festival's 53rd edition was canceled, in Angoulême, southwestern France, the Grand Off and Interconnected Comic Book Festivals, conducted in around 15 European cities, kept the art alive.

title: 'Trump has struck at the heart of the defense pact forged between the US and Europe in 1949: Trust'
subhead: The drama surrounding Donald Trump's willingness to annex Greenland, by force or by negotiation, has dealt a lasting blow to NATO's credibility, explains columnist Alain Frachon.

Thomas Piketty: 'European countries have achieved unprecedented levels of prosperity and social well-being'
subhead: To win the cultural and intellectual battle, Europe must staunchly defend its model, writes the economist in his column, dismantling the narrative of a 'declining' continent.

title: Blocking the Russian army: Ukraine's impossible mission
subhead: With limited technical and human resources, soldiers and engineers in these units, increasingly exposed to drone fire, are trying to contain the Russian army, which continues to make slow but steady advances.

title: Who's running in the Paris mayoral election?
subhead: Six main candidates are vying to succeed Mayor Anne Hidalgo, who is not running for re-election, in the municipal elections on March 15 and 22.
